summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated March 4, 2021, transmitting a rough first draft of the government's third bail opposition filing in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The sender seeks feedback on highlighted language and sections, notes the draft is longer than expected, and mentions awaiting feedback regarding France for the citizenship/extradition section.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email, working on the government's third bail opposition filing against Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking feedback on the draft.

events.title: Draft Bail Opposition Prepared
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a rough first draft of the government's third bail opposition filing in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to a colleague for feedback.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an internal government email regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
It references a draft of the government's third bail opposition filing, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in March 2021.
The draft includes a section on citizenship and extradition related to France, suggesting international legal considerations.
The email notes the draft is longer than expected, showing the complexity of the government's arguments.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
